intro: Kandemiria mollis, commonly known as the soft-leaved kandemiria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. Kandemiria mollis is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
